original_title: Defaulted installment vehicles can't be seized if owner objects: Minister
original_body_lines: Banks and leasing companies can seize vehicles in the event of default in leasing installments only if the owner of the vehicle does not object to it, State Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said.
He told parliament that vehicles with defaulted installment payments are not seized under the Parate law.
The Minister said this while making a special statement in Parliament on the Parate execution law.
He said banks or financial institutions have the authority to seize property in question only if the loan amount exceeds Rs. 5 million.

The Minister said 19 banks and financial institutions had implemented the Parate law only in 173 occasions for loans for a tune of Rs. 15 billion from January to June this year. (Ajith Siriwardana and Yohan Perea)
